name: Pio Abad, Untitled (Inventory), 2013
description: Digital print on silk twill 40 x 40cm Edition of 20 + 1 AP. Zabludowicz Collection and London based, Manila born, artist Pio Abad have joined forces to produce a limited edition artwork to raise funds for people affected by Typhoon Haiyan. All proceeds from the sale of the edition will go directly to United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees which is working with authorities in the Philippines to decongest overcrowded evacuation centres housing survivors of Typhoon Haiyan. There are millions of people who have been affected, including hundreds of thousands who have been forced from their homes. There are countless dead. Those who have survived now need urgent help including emergency shelter, clean water and food. Using the silk scarf as a contemporary reimagining of the vanitas still life, the edition features digital scans of ink drawings produced by the artist from an expanding personal archive of images. Here flotsam gathered on the beaches of the Northern Philippines lies alongside domestic objects recovered from zones of conflict and forgotten artefacts stored deep in museum archives. Laid out in a decorative formation, these objects, all that is left of someoneâ€™s life or possessions, become reminiscent of the stars on a flag or jewels on a necklace. Silk scarves are the ultimate luxury object; beautiful and desirable. Abad has regularly returned to this unusual material as his medium, stripping them of their wearable function and employing them as surfaces for the telling of (hi)stories. Here for the first time he has decided to edition one of his usually unique silk artworks in order to raise funds for rescue efforts in the Philippines.

name: Andy Holden, MI!MS
description:
This publication has been produced in an edition of 750 to coincide with the Zabludowicz Collection Annual Commission: Andy Holden, Maximum Irony! Maximum Sincerity 1999-2003, Towards a Unified Theory of MI!MS at Zabludowicz Collection (26 September â€“ 15 December 2013) and at Spike Island (03 May â€“ 29 June 2014).
In this publication you will find documentation of the work at every stage of its development. From the initial sketches to the final installation. Contributions by Catherine Wood, Gil Leung and Fiona Parry.

Curated by Elizabeth Neilson
Edited by Andy Holden and Elizabeth Neilson
Designed by Malcolm Southward and Mark Holt

The book will be available from Wednesday 27 November, but you can pre-order it now! 

You can purchase it at a reduced price of Â£24 in our shop for the run of the exhibition.

name: PAINTING from the ZABLUDOWICZ COLLECTION
description:
This publication has been produced in an edition of 500 to coincide with Painting from the Zabludowicz Collection at Zabludowicz Collection, London 28 February â€“ 11 August 2013. The season consisted of two parts:

Part I: 28 February â€“ 5 May
Albert Oehlen
Francesca DiMattio
Matthew Chambers

Part II: 23 May â€“ 11 August
Albert Oehlen 
Josh Smith
Painting in the 2.5th Dimension: Tauba Auerbach, Jessica Dickinson, Sam Falls, Alex Hubbard, Nathan Hylden, Rosy Keyser, Michael E. Smith, Ned Vena.

The fully illustrated, hard-backed book contains exclusive interviews with the 12 artists in the show.

Curated and Edited by Ellen Mara De Wachter
Designed by Malcolm Southward and Mark Holt

name: Weighted Words
description:
Published to coincide with Weighted Words, 1 March - 10 June 2012.

This publication, the collection's fifteenth to date, contains contributions made or selected by nine artists whose work is installed in the exhibition: script excerpts from the works of Ryan Trecartin, Mary Reid Kelley, Alexandre Singh, and Ed Atkins; lyrics from a selection of songs from Ruth Ewan's A Jukebox of People Trying to Change the World; illustrations from Omer Fast's And Her Face Was Covered (Part II); and an interpretative essay by Bennett Simpson on the paintings of Genn Ligon.

Edition of 500, design by Malcolm Southward and Mark Holt.

name: Laurel Nakadate 365 days: a catalogue of tears
description:
The artist has signed 50 copies of her new book, 365 Days: A Catalogue of Tears, available exclusively at the Zabludowicz Collection. 
Buy your copy now!

Limited edition artist's book by Laurel Nakadate to coincide with her first UK solo exhibition. The book includes an essay by acclaimed author Rick Moody and features the impressive photographic series 365 Days: A Catalogue of Tears (2010), for which the artist photographed herself crying every day for a year in order to "deliberately take part in sadness each day".

Edition of 2000, design by Malcolm Southward.

Also available Zabludowicz Collection Bundle with a fantastic 25% off!

Please contact us on 0207 428 8940 if you require assistance.

name: Iain Forsyth and Jane Pollard the thin red line, 2008
description: Embroidered woolen scarf Edition of 25 Based on the traditional Oxbridge academic scarf, â€˜The thin red lineâ€™ is for those who stand their ground, a sartorial symbol of defiance. The scarf embodies the form of a thin red line, and the embroidered motto refers to the origins of the title. The phrase â€˜the thin red lineâ€™ derives from the Crimean War, when during the Battle of Balaclava on 25th October 1854 the heavily depleted British Armyâ€™s 93rd regiment faced a Russian cavalry charge with a line of men only two deep instead of the conventional four. The soldiers were led by Sir Colin Campbell, who is said to have told his men â€™There is no retreat from here, men. You must die where you standâ€™. Iain Forsyth and Jane Pollard at zabludowiczcollection.com All proceeds from our editions are split equally between the artist and the Zabludowicz Collection Interaction Programme.

name: Ryan Gander, Investigation #4 - Meaning's all around me now, 2010
description: 3D Viewfinder and reel Edition of 25 Produced to coincide with The Library of Babel / In and Out of Place, an exhibition of more than 200 works from the Zabludowicz Collection curated by Anna-Catharina Gebbers as a result of her residency with the collection. Gander created a hanging model depicting elements of the Didactease emblem in 3D form; the image reel features 14 3D photographs of this model, an image of the emblem itself is shown on the centre of the reel. The Didactease emblem uses advanced mathematical symbols to produce the sentence â€˜There exists only one definition for everything, everywhere at any one timeâ€™ and is used repeatedly in Ryan Ganderâ€™s work. Ryan Gander at zabludowiczcollection.com All proceeds from our editions are split equally between the artist and the Zabludowicz Collection Interaction Programme.

name: Matt Stokes, Club Ponderosa T-shirt, 2009
description: FINAL FEW AVAILABLE A reminder of one of the busiest and most fun series of events the Zabludowicz Collection has ever hosted, this T-shirt is a must for anyone who visited, participated or wishes they'd been to Club Ponderosa, created by Matt Stokes in 2009. The T-shirt is emblazoned on the back with a graphic adaptation of the Sioux symbol for shelter, designed by Stokes as the logo for Club Ponderosa. Club Ponderosa was established by Matt Stokes during an artist's residency with the Zabludowicz Collection 176. The impressive building that houses the gallery was formerly a Methodist Chapel, built in 1867, and once home to the infamous London Drama Centre. Drawing from this history, the club occupied the rear exhibition space (which was often used by the chapel and LDC for public performances), and operated as part meeting house, nightclub, theatre, village hall and social club. It opened its doors on the 22nd February 2009. The aim of Club Ponderosa was to create an informal and flexible social-space that would foster new encounters between groups, and act as a catalyst for the creation of events designed and programmed in collaboration with people living or working in the Camden area. Use of the space and entry was free, and events had a non-commercial emphasis. Participants included non-profit theatre groups, musicians and bands, ecological and historical societies, informal collectives, craftspeople, fashion designers and artists â€¦ and many more. The club closed on the 27th June 2009, and the myspace page that publicised events during its existence, now acts as a record of what took place: Club Ponderosa on Myspace

name: Nicole Wermers, Rock Dispenser / model for outdoor sculpture, 2010
description: Ready-made stainless steel dispenser, found rocks and pebbles arranged by the artist. 19 cm high, 6 cm diameter approx. Edition of 30 unique rock combinations All proceeds from our editions are split equally between the artist and the Zabludowicz Collection Interaction Programme.

name: Toby Ziegler, The Alienation of Objects (altered and signed by the artist), 2010
description: Artists book re-covered with animal skin and paper insertions. 19 x 14 cm approx. Edition of 10 Toby Ziegler at zabludowiczcollection.com All proceeds from our editions are split equally between the artist and the Zabludowicz Collection Interaction Programme.

name: Zabludowicz Collection Tote bag
description:
The Zabludowicz Collection Tote bag.
Lightweight cotton bag, available in green, electric blue or black  featuring the Zabludowicz logo.

100% Cotton

name: Life drawing classes bundle: 10 classes
description:
Give something special this year by giving the gift of art. 

Or why not get creative yourself? 

Buy our Life Drawing bundle and get 10 classes for the price of 9.

Explore the current exhibitions and the unique architectural setting through the human figure. Working with a range of materials, these classes encourage you to examine and interpret artworks by responding to the poses and movements of the life models.

Suitable for all levels
